Reviews.Title: Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Robin S Heeg
Reviews.Content: I had a windows XP and wanted to upgrade to a newer version. It is a lot different and will take a little more time to get use to the difference between the two computers.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: pablo
Reviews.Content: I do not like it because I paid for laptop AMD E-300 Dual-core 1.3 GHz Processor, and the one they send to me is only 1.3 ghz, it is not dual.

Reviews.Title: Very good.
Reviews.Author: Marlys Lundell
Reviews.Content: I like the computer as it is much faster and more up to date than my previous one.  I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Hate Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Edward V. Ohalloran
Reviews.Content: The HP is a good computer my complaint is they caved to Microsoft and will not allow you to select the OS of your choosing. Under Win 8 most of your existing Software will not work. No Software is included with the HP.My next PC will definately be a Mac. Good bye and good riddance to HP and Mr. Gates who is so destitute that he must yoke the Consumer at leaste every other year, and folks like HP are up his Butt.Does your HP have an odd odor to it, Smells like kickback or dog crap too me.Ed

Reviews.Title: it works great  (except)
Reviews.Author: lonewolf
Reviews.Content: it works great except I was use to windows xp and this one has windows 8  I don't like windows 8 and I don't like all the apps,im a simple computer person  I like for it to be simple .later if I find a xp program im taking win 8 out completely,hate the apps hate the apps

Reviews.Title: GOOD
Reviews.Author: edson
Reviews.Content: this pc is fine for someone who is a beginner, but if you work hard all day long sticks, I think they should put more memory 1g.outwardly very cute and I like to bring the windows 8 installed.

Reviews.Title: You Get Less than what you pay for....
Reviews.Author: A. Morgan
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know, a laptop under $400 -shouldn't expect much - and that is very true - you shouldn't expect much. We bought this for our 10 year old son. He has moved to a school which will require presentations (and they use PC / Windows 8) and he had asked for a computer for his birthday. We have been MAC users since 2005 - not because we 'love' MAC but because we moved to the States from England and our laptops crashed and we just tried MAC's. However, since getting this computer for our son and loading it up etc we have realized why the next computer he will get will be a MAC. The interface is horrible. Windows 8 is confusing. The feel of the laptop is uncomfortable and awkward to use. The load up time is painfully slow (and I mean PAINFULLY SLOW) - navigation is irritating. You're not sure whether the item you have downloaded (Printer Drivers for instance) have actually loaded - no indication that it has finished. Trying to find the settings was frustration as you have to move the cursor to the bottom right of the screen (who knew!!!!). My son uses PC's at school, and even he is sitting shouting the the computer trying to figure something out. It is just not intuitive to use. I should have realized something was up when a 10 min basic set up at Best Buy (a free service when buying a new laptop) turned into a 55 min set up with the assistant saying "Never known a laptop be so slow". This experience has made us more of a MAC snob. We will never by PC again - it is just too hard and frustrating and slow. Sorry son, we'll get you a decent computer next time.
